title: Supervisor/employee at the Vienna Social Psychiatric Center at Caritas of the Archdiocese of Vienna
text:
Vienna Social Psychiatric Center Announces Part-Time Position to Expand Mental Health Services – Urgent Hiring News Vienna, Austria – In a move signaling a commitment to expanding mental health support, the Social Psychiatric Center Vienna has announced a new part-time position, effective November 2025. This breaking news comes at a crucial time, as demand for mental health services continues to rise globally and locally. The center’s proactive approach to staffing underscores the importance of accessible and compassionate care for individuals navigating mental health challenges. This is a significant development for both job seekers in the social work field and the Vienna community.
What the New Role Entails: Supporting Self-Determination The 30-hour-per-week position will focus on providing direct support to clients of the Social Psychiatric Center. Key responsibilities include organizing and leading leisure activities and group sessions, offering everyday guidance, facilitating individual and group discussions, and collaboratively developing personalized support plans. Crucially, the role emphasizes documentation of client progress and consistent evaluation of support measures. Successful candidates will also collaborate with other specialists, family members, and external institutions to ensure holistic care. This isn’t just about providing services; it’s about empowering individuals to live self-determined lives.
Who is the Ideal Candidate? A Blend of Skills and Empathy The Social Psychiatric Center is seeking qualified professionals with a completed specialist training – such as occupational therapy, physiotherapy, social work, or social counseling. Prior experience working with individuals experiencing mental illness is essential. While a UBV (federal professional qualification) isn’t mandatory, it’s highly desirable. Beyond formal qualifications, the center prioritizes candidates who demonstrate empathy, patience, and strong communication skills. A valid driving license (Class B), a current first aid certification, and Hep-B vaccination (or willingness to obtain it) are also required. Good PC skills are a must, and a willingness to engage in ongoing professional development is strongly encouraged. The center is actively seeking to diversify its team and welcomes applications from individuals of all backgrounds.
Beyond the Paycheck: A Commitment to Employee Wellbeing The position offers a competitive salary ranging from €2,397.62 to €2,952.62 gross per month (based on 30 hours/week and SEG allowances, factoring in training and experience). However, the benefits package extends far beyond financial compensation. Employees can benefit from a job ticket subsidy for public transport, flexibility allowances, vouchers for families, tax-advantaged food vouchers, and additional days off. The center also fosters a supportive work environment with flat hierarchies, regular supervision, and opportunities for further education. This holistic approach to employee wellbeing is a key differentiator, recognizing that those providing mental health support also need support themselves.
The Growing Need for Mental Health Professionals: A Global Perspective This announcement arrives amidst a growing global awareness of mental health challenges. The COVID-19 pandemic, economic uncertainties, and increasing social pressures have all contributed to a rise in reported mental health concerns. Organizations like the World Health Organization (WHO) are actively promoting mental health as a fundamental human right, and there’s a growing recognition of the need for increased investment in mental health services. In Austria, and particularly in Vienna, the Social Psychiatric Center is responding to this need by expanding its team and enhancing its capacity to provide vital support. Understanding the WHO’s mental health initiatives can provide valuable context to this local development.
The Social Psychiatric Center Vienna’s commitment to providing compassionate, individualized care, coupled with its investment in employee wellbeing, positions it as a leader in the field. For those seeking a rewarding career making a tangible difference in the lives of others, this part-time position represents a significant opportunity. Interested candidates are encouraged to apply promptly through the center’s online application portal.
